Hugh Winkler schrieb:
> RFC2616 doesn't tell a server how to store the resource. All that has to 
> happen is that when you GET from the same URI the server return some 
> content in whatever Content-type it chooses, reflecting your earlier PUT.

Yes, but it does say that it *stores* it. So, if anybody wants to re-use 
PUT as some kind of POST or PROPPATCH, that's not what it is for.

> AFAICT you are making some corner case where, when you do a GET, the 
> server returns Content-type application/x-www-form-urlencoded. Could 
> happen I guess.  As long as the server returns the same name value pairs 
> in the same order, why would you care how the server stored the pairs?
> 
> In the typical case, GET on the URI would return a text/html 
> representation of the name-value pairs, not 
> application/x-www-form-urlencoded.

Yes, that's perfectly ok.

Best regards, Julian
